critique: This document pertains to land use and resource management in Arkansas during the 1930s. It revokes a previous executive order and temporarily withdraws land for reforestation and soil erosion control by the Department of Agriculture. Given the context of the New Deal era, this suggests a moderate level of government intervention in the economy and resource management. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, executive power expansion, or impacts on civil liberties. The federal government is asserting control over land use, indicating a leaning towards federal primacy. There is an element of social inclusion by way of land management.
